<p>The release notes for the ROCm platform.</p>
<hr />
<h2>ROCm 5.5.1</h2>
<!-- markdownlint-disable first-line-h1 -->
<!-- markdownlint-disable no-duplicate-header -->
<h3>What's New in This Release</h3>
<h4>HIP API Change</h4>
<p>The following HIP API is updated in the ROCm v5.5.1 release,</p>
<h5><code>hipDeviceSetCacheConfig</code></h5>
<ul>
<li>The return value for <code>hipDeviceSetCacheConfig</code> is updated from <code>hipErrorNotSupported</code> to <code>hipSuccess</code></li>
</ul>
<h3>Library Changes in ROCM 5.5.1</h3>
<p>| Library | Version |
|---------|---------|
| hipBLAS | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.5.1">0.54.0</a> |
| hipCUB | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipCUB/releases/tag/rocm-5.5.1">2.13.1</a> |

<hr />
<h2>ROCm 5.5.0</h2>
<!-- markdownlint-disable first-line-h1 -->
<!-- markdownlint-disable no-duplicate-header -->
<h3>What's New in This Release</h3>
<h4>HIP Enhancements</h4>
<p>The ROCm v5.5 release consists of the following HIP enhancements:</p>
<h5>Enhanced Stack Size Limit</h5>
<p>In this release, the stack size limit is increased from 16k to 131056 bytes (or 128K - 16).
Applications requiring to update the stack size can use hipDeviceSetLimit API.</p>
<h5><code>hipcc</code> Changes</h5>
<p>The following hipcc changes are implemented in this release:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>hipcc</code> will not implicitly link to <code>libpthread</code> and <code>librt</code>, as they are no longer a link time dependence for HIP programs.Â  Applications that depend on these libraries must explicitly link to them.</li>
<li><code>-use-staticlib</code> and <code>-use-sharedlib</code> options are deprecated.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Future Changes</h5>
<ul>
<li>Separation of <code>hipcc</code> binaries (Perl scripts) from HIP to <code>hipcc</code> project. Users will access separate <code>hipcc</code> package for installing <code>hipcc</code> binaries in future ROCm releases.</li>
<li>In a future ROCm release, the following samples will be removed from the <code>hip-tests</code> project.</li>
<li><code>hipBusbandWidth</code> at <a href="https://github.com/ROCm-Developer-Tools/hip-tests/tree/develop/samples/1_Utils/shipBusBandwidth">https://github.com/ROCm-Developer-Tools/hip-tests/tree/develop/samples/1_Utils/shipBusBandwidth</a></li>
<li><code>hipCommander</code> at <a href="https://github.com/ROCm-Developer-Tools/hip-tests/tree/develop/samples/1_Utils/hipCommander">https://github.com/ROCm-Developer-Tools/hip-tests/tree/develop/samples/1_Utils/hipCommander</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Note that the samples will continue to be available in previous release branches.</p>
<h5>New HIP APIs in This Release</h5>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>This is a pre-official version (beta) release of the new APIs and may contain unresolved issues.</p>
</blockquote>
<h6>Memory Management HIP APIs</h6>
<p>The new memory management HIP API is as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li>Sets information on the specified pointer [BETA].</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipPointerSetAttribute(const void* value, hipPointer_attribute attribute, hipDeviceptr_t ptr);</code></p>
<h6>Module Management HIP APIs</h6>
<p>The new module management HIP APIs are as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li>Launches kernel $f$ with launch parameters and shared memory on stream with arguments passed to <code>kernelParams</code>, where thread blocks can cooperate and synchronize as they execute.</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipModuleLaunchCooperativeKernel(hipFunction_t f, unsigned int gridDimX, unsigned int gridDimY, unsigned int gridDimZ, unsigned int blockDimX, unsigned int blockDimY, unsigned int blockDimZ, unsigned int sharedMemBytes, hipStream_t stream, void** kernelParams);</code></p>
<ul>
<li>Launches kernels on multiple devices where thread blocks can cooperate and synchronize as they execute.</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipModuleLaunchCooperativeKernelMultiDevice(hipFunctionLaunchParams* launchParamsList, unsigned int numDevices, unsigned int flags);</code></p>
<h6>HIP Graph Management APIs</h6>
<p>The new HIP Graph Management APIs are as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li>Creates a memory allocation node and adds it to a graph [BETA]</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipGraphAddMemAllocNode(hipGraphNode_t* pGraphNode, hipGraph_t graph, const hipGraphNode_t* pDependencies, size_t numDependencies, hipMemAllocNodeParams* pNodeParams);</code></p>
<ul>
<li>Return parameters for memory allocation node [BETA]</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipGraphMemAllocNodeGetParams(hipGraphNode_t node, hipMemAllocNodeParams* pNodeParams);</code></p>
<ul>
<li>Creates a memory free node and adds it to a graph [BETA]</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipGraphAddMemFreeNode(hipGraphNode_t* pGraphNode, hipGraph_t graph, const hipGraphNode_t* pDependencies, size_t numDependencies, void* dev_ptr);</code></p>
<ul>
<li>Returns parameters for memory free node [BETA].</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipGraphMemFreeNodeGetParams(hipGraphNode_t node, void* dev_ptr);</code></p>
<ul>
<li>Write a DOT file describing graph structure [BETA].</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipGraphDebugDotPrint(hipGraph_t graph, const char* path, unsigned int flags);</code></p>
<ul>
<li>Copies attributes from source node to destination node [BETA].</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipGraphKernelNodeCopyAttributes(hipGraphNode_t hSrc, hipGraphNode_t hDst);</code></p>
<ul>
<li>Enables or disables the specified node in the given graphExec [BETA]</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipGraphNodeSetEnabled(hipGraphExec_t hGraphExec, hipGraphNode_t hNode, unsigned int isEnabled);</code></p>
<ul>
<li>Query whether a node in the given graphExec is enabled [BETA]</li>
</ul>
<p><code>h
  hipError_t hipGraphNodeGetEnabled(hipGraphExec_t hGraphExec, hipGraphNode_t hNode, unsigned int* isEnabled);</code></p>
<h5>OpenMP Enhancements</h5>
<p>This release consists of the following OpenMP enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Additional support for OMPT functions <code>get_device_time</code> and <code>get_record_type</code>.</li>
<li>Add support for min/max fast fp atomics on AMD GPUs.</li>
<li>Fix the use of the abs function in C device regions.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Deprecations and Warnings</h3>
<h4>HIP Deprecation</h4>
<p>The <code>hipcc</code> and <code>hipconfig</code> Perl scripts are deprecated. In a future release, compiled binaries will be available as <code>hipcc.bin</code> and <code>hipconfig.bin</code> as replacements for the Perl scripts.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>There will be a transition period where the Perl scripts and compiled binaries are available  before the scripts are removed. There will be no functional difference between the Perl scripts and their compiled binary counterpart. No user action is required. Once these are available, users can optionally switch to <code>hipcc.bin</code> and <code>hipconfig.bin</code>. The <code>hipcc</code>/<code>hipconfig</code> soft link will be assimilated to point from <code>hipcc</code>/<code>hipconfig</code> to the respective compiled binaries as the default option.</p>
</blockquote>
<h5>Linux Filesystem Hierarchy Standard for ROCm</h5>
<p>ROCm packages have adopted the Linux foundation filesystem hierarchy standard in this release to ensure ROCm components follow open source conventions for Linux-based distributions. While moving to a new filesystem hierarchy, ROCm ensures backward compatibility with its 5.1 version or older filesystem hierarchy. See below for a detailed explanation of the new filesystem hierarchy and backward compatibility.</p>
<h5>New Filesystem Hierarchy</h5>
<p>The following is the new filesystem hierarchy:4</p>
<p>```text
/opt/rocm-<ver>
    | --bin
      | --All externally exposed Binaries
    | --libexec
        | --<component>
            | -- Component specific private non-ISA executables (architecture independent)
    | --include
        | -- <component>
            | --<header files>
    | --lib
        | --lib<soname>.so -&gt; lib<soname>.so.major -&gt; lib<soname>.so.major.minor.patch
            (public libraries linked with application)
        | --<component> (component specific private library, executable data)
        | --<cmake>
            | --components
                | --<component>.config.cmake
    | --share
        | --html/<component>/<em>.html
        | --info/<component>/</em>.[pdf, md, txt]
        | --man
        | --doc
            | --<component>
                | --<licenses>
        | --<component>
            | --<misc files> (arch independent non-executable)
            | --samples</p>
<p>```</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>ROCm will not support backward compatibility with the v5.1(old) file system hierarchy in its next major release.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>For more information, refer to <a href="https://refspecs.linuxfoundation.org/fhs.shtml">https://refspecs.linuxfoundation.org/fhs.shtml</a>.</p>
<h5>Backward Compatibility with Older Filesystems</h5>
<p>ROCm has moved header files and libraries to its new location as indicated in the above structure and included symbolic-link and wrapper header files in its old location for backward compatibility.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>ROCm will continue supporting backward compatibility until the next major release.</p>
</blockquote>
<h5>Wrapper header files</h5>
<p>Wrapper header files are placed in the old location (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/&lt;component&gt;/include</code>) with a warning message to include files from the new location (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/include</code>) as shown in the example below:</p>
<p>```h
// Code snippet from hip_runtime.h</p>
<h1>pragma message âThis file is deprecated. Use file from include path /opt/rocm-ver/include/ and prefix with hipâ.</h1>
<h1>include "hip/hip_runtime.h"</h1>
<p>```</p>
<p>The wrapper header filesâ backward compatibility deprecation is as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>#pragma</code> message announcing deprecation -- ROCm v5.2 release</li>
<li><code>#pragma</code> message changed to <code>#warning</code> -- Future release</li>
<li><code>#warning</code> changed to <code>#error</code> -- Future release</li>
<li>Backward compatibility wrappers removed -- Future release</li>
</ul>
<h5>Library files</h5>
<p>Library files are available in the <code>/opt/rocm-xxx/lib</code> folder. For backward compatibility, the old library location (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/&lt;component&gt;/lib</code>) has a soft link to the library at the new location.</p>
<p>Example:</p>
<p><code>log
$ ls -l /opt/rocm/hip/lib/
total 4
drwxr-xr-x 4 root root 4096 May 12 10:45 cmake
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root   24 May 10 23:32 libamdhip64.so -&gt; ../../lib/libamdhip64.so</code></p>
<h5>CMake Config files</h5>
<p>All CMake configuration files are available in the <code>/opt/rocm-xxx/lib/cmake/&lt;component&gt;</code> folder.
For backward compatibility, the old CMake locations (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/&lt;component&gt;/lib/cmake</code>) consist of a soft link to the new CMake config.</p>
<p>Example:</p>
<p><code>log
$ ls -l /opt/rocm/hip/lib/cmake/hip/
total 0
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 42 May 10 23:32 hip-config.cmake -&gt; ../../../../lib/cmake/hip/hip-config.cmake</code></p>
<h4>ROCm Support For Code Object V3 Deprecated</h4>
<p>Support for Code Object v3 is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.</p>
<h4>Comgr V3.0 Changes</h4>
<p>The following APIs and macros have been marked as deprecated. These are expected to be removed in a future ROCm release and coincides with the release of Comgr v3.0.</p>
<h5>API Changes</h5>
<ul>
<li><code>amd_comgr_action_info_set_options()</code></li>
<li><code>amd_comgr_action_info_get_options()</code></li>
</ul>
<h5>Actions and Data Types</h5>
<ul>
<li><code>AMD_COMGR_ACTION_ADD_DEVICE_LIBRARIES</code></li>
<li><code>AMD_COMGR_ACTION_COMPILE_SOURCE_TO_FATBIN</code></li>
</ul>
<p>For replacements, see the <code>AMD_COMGR_ACTION_INFO_GET</code>/<code>SET_OPTION_LIST APIs</code>, and the <code>AMD_COMGR_ACTION_COMPILE_SOURCE_(WITH_DEVICE_LIBS)_TO_BC</code> macros.</p>
<h4>Deprecated Environment Variables</h4>
<p>The following environment variables are removed in this ROCm release:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>GPU_MAX_COMMAND_QUEUES</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_MAX_WORKGROUP_SIZE_2D_X</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_MAX_WORKGROUP_SIZE_2D_Y</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_MAX_WORKGROUP_SIZE_3D_X</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_MAX_WORKGROUP_SIZE_3D_Y</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_MAX_WORKGROUP_SIZE_3D_Z</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_BLIT_ENGINE_TYPE</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_USE_SYNC_OBJECTS</code></li>
<li><code>AMD_OCL_SC_LIB</code></li>
<li><code>AMD_OCL_ENABLE_MESSAGE_BOX</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_FORCE_64BIT_PTR</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_FORCE_OCL20_32BIT</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_RAW_TIMESTAMP</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_SELECT_COMPUTE_RINGS_ID</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_USE_SINGLE_SCRATCH</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_ENABLE_LARGE_ALLOCATION</code></li>
<li><code>HSA_LOCAL_MEMORY_ENABLE</code></li>
<li><code>HSA_ENABLE_COARSE_GRAIN_SVM</code></li>
<li><code>GPU_IFH_MODE</code></li>
<li><code>OCL_SYSMEM_REQUIREMENT</code></li>
<li><code>OCL_CODE_CACHE_ENABLE</code></li>
<li><code>OCL_CODE_CACHE_RESET</code></li>
</ul>
<h3>Known Issues In This Release</h3>
<p>The following are the known issues in this release.</p>
<h4><code>DISTRIBUTED</code>/<code>TEST_DISTRIBUTED_SPAWN</code> Fails</h4>
<p>When user applications call <code>ncclCommAbort</code> to destruct communicators and then create new
communicators repeatedly, subsequent communicators may fail to initialize.</p>
<p>This issue is under investigation and will be resolved in a future release.</p>
<h4>Failures In HIP Directed Tests</h4>
<p>Multiple HIP directed tests fail.</p>
<h3>Library Changes in ROCM 5.5.0</h3>

<h4>hipBLAS 0.54.0</h4>
<p>hipBLAS 0.54.0 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>added option to opt-in to use __half for hipblasHalf type in the API for c++ users who define HIPBLAS_USE_HIP_HALF</li>
<li>added scripts to plot performance for multiple functions</li>
<li>data driven hipblas-bench and hipblas-test execution via external yaml format data files</li>
<li>client smoke test added for quick validation using command hipblas-test --yaml hipblas_smoke.yaml</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>fixed datatype conversion functions to support more rocBLAS/cuBLAS datatypes</li>
<li>fixed geqrf to return successfully when nullptrs are passed in with n == 0 || m == 0</li>
<li>fixed getrs to return successfully when given nullptrs with corresponding size = 0</li>
<li>fixed getrs to give info = -1 when transpose is not an expected type</li>
<li>fixed gels to return successfully when given nullptrs with corresponding size = 0</li>
<li>fixed gels to give info = -1 when transpose is not in (&#39;N&#39;, &#39;T&#39;) for real cases or not in (&#39;N&#39;, &#39;C&#39;) for complex cases</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>changed reference code for Windows to OpenBLAS</li>
<li>hipblas client executables all now begin with hipblas- prefix</li>
</ul>
<h4>hipCUB 2.13.1</h4>
<p>hipCUB 2.13.1 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Benchmarks for <code>BlockShuffle</code>, <code>BlockLoad</code>, and <code>BlockStore</code>.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>CUB backend references CUB and Thrust version 1.17.2.</li>
<li>Improved benchmark coverage of <code>BlockScan</code> by adding <code>ExclusiveScan</code>, benchmark coverage of <code>BlockRadixSort</code> by adding <code>SortBlockedToStriped</code>, and benchmark coverage of <code>WarpScan</code> by adding <code>Broadcast</code>.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Windows HIP SDK support</li>
</ul>
<h5>Known Issues</h5>
<ul>
<li><code>BlockRadixRankMatch</code> is currently broken under the rocPRIM backend.</li>
<li><code>BlockRadixRankMatch</code> with a warp size that does not exactly divide the block size is broken under the CUB backend.</li>
</ul>
<h4>hipFFT 1.0.11</h4>
<p>hipFFT 1.0.11 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Fixed old version rocm include/lib folders not removed on upgrade.</li>
</ul>
<h4>hipSOLVER 1.7.0</h4>
<p>hipSOLVER 1.7.0 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added functions</li>
<li>gesvdj<ul>
<li>hipsolverSgesvdj_bufferSize, hipsolverDgesvdj_bufferSize, hipsolverCgesvdj_bufferSize, hipsolverZgesvdj_bufferSize</li>
<li>hipsolverSgesvdj, hipsolverDgesvdj, hipsolverCgesvdj, hipsolverZgesvdj</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>gesvdjBatched<ul>
<li>hipsolverSgesvdjBatched_bufferSize, hipsolverDgesvdjBatched_bufferSize, hipsolverCgesvdjBatched_bufferSize, hipsolverZgesvdjBatched_bufferSize</li>
<li>hipsolverSgesvdjBatched, hipsolverDgesvdjBatched, hipsolverCgesvdjBatched, hipsolverZgesvdjBatched</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>hipSPARSE 2.3.5</h4>
<p>hipSPARSE 2.3.5 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Improved</h5>
<ul>
<li>Fixed an issue, where the rocm folder was not removed on upgrade of meta packages</li>
<li>Fixed a compilation issue with cusparse backend</li>
<li>Added more detailed messages on unit test failures due to missing input data</li>
<li>Improved documentation</li>
<li>Fixed a bug with deprecation messages when using gcc9 (Thanks @Maetveis)</li>
</ul>
<h4>rccl 2.15.5</h4>
<p>RCCL 2.15.5 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Compatibility with NCCL 2.15.5</li>
<li>Unit test executable renamed to rccl-UnitTests</li>
</ul>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>HW-topology aware binary tree implementation</li>
<li>Experimental support for MSCCL</li>
<li>New unit tests for hipGraph support</li>
<li>NPKit integration</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>rocm-smi ID conversion</li>
<li>Support for HIP_VISIBLE_DEVICES for unit tests</li>
<li>Support for p2p transfers to non (HIP) visible devices</li>
</ul>
<h5>Removed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Removed TransferBench from tools.  Exists in standalone repo: https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/TransferBench</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocALUTION 2.1.8</h4>
<p>rocALUTION 2.1.8 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added build support for Navi32</li>
</ul>
<h5>Improved</h5>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a typo in MPI backend</li>
<li>Fixed a bug with the backend when HIP support is disabled</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in SAAMG hierarchy building on HIP backend</li>
<li>Improved SAAMG hierarchy build performance on HIP backend</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>LocalVector::GetIndexValues(ValueType*) is deprecated, use LocalVector::GetIndexValues(const LocalVector&amp;, LocalVector*) instead</li>
<li>LocalVector::SetIndexValues(const ValueType*) is deprecated, use LocalVector::SetIndexValues(const LocalVector&amp;, const LocalVector&amp;) instead</li>
<li>LocalMatrix::RSDirectInterpolation(const LocalVector&amp;, const LocalVector&amp;, LocalMatrix*, LocalMatrix*) is deprecated, use LocalMatrix::RSDirectInterpolation(const LocalVector&amp;, const LocalVector&amp;, LocalMatrix*) instead</li>
<li>LocalMatrix::RSExtPIInterpolation(const LocalVector&amp;, const LocalVector&amp;, bool, float, LocalMatrix*, LocalMatrix*) is deprecated, use LocalMatrix::RSExtPIInterpolation(const LocalVector&amp;, const LocalVector&amp;, bool, LocalMatrix*) instead</li>
<li>LocalMatrix::RugeStueben() is deprecated</li>
<li>LocalMatrix::AMGSmoothedAggregation(ValueType, const LocalVector&amp;, const LocalVector&amp;, LocalMatrix*, LocalMatrix*, int) is deprecated, use LocalMatrix::AMGAggregation(ValueType, const LocalVector&amp;, const LocalVector&amp;, LocalMatrix*, int) instead</li>
<li>LocalMatrix::AMGAggregation(const LocalVector&amp;, LocalMatrix*, LocalMatrix*) is deprecated, use LocalMatrix::AMGAggregation(const LocalVector&amp;, LocalMatrix*) instead</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocBLAS 2.47.0</h4>
<p>rocBLAS 2.47.0 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>added functionality rocblas_geam_ex for matrix-matrix minimum operations</li>
<li>added HIP Graph support as beta feature for rocBLAS Level 1, Level 2, and Level 3(pointer mode host) functions</li>
<li>added beta features API. Exposed using compiler define ROCBLAS_BETA_FEATURES_API</li>
<li>added support for vector initialization in the rocBLAS test framework with negative increments</li>
<li>added windows build documentation for forthcoming support using ROCm HIP SDK</li>
<li>added scripts to plot performance for multiple functions</li>
</ul>
<h5>Optimizations</h5>
<ul>
<li>improved performance of Level 2 rocBLAS GEMV for float and double precision. Performance enhanced by 150-200% for certain problem sizes when (m==n) measured on a gfx90a GPU.</li>
<li>improved performance of Level 2 rocBLAS GER for float, double and complex float precisions. Performance enhanced by 5-7% for certain problem sizes measured on a gfx90a GPU.</li>
<li>improved performance of Level 2 rocBLAS SYMV for float and double precisions. Performance enhanced by 120-150% for certain problem sizes measured on both gfx908 and gfx90a GPUs.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>fixed setting of executable mode on client script rocblas_gentest.py to avoid potential permission errors with clients rocblas-test and rocblas-bench</li>
<li>fixed deprecated API compatibility with Visual Studio compiler</li>
<li>fixed test framework memory exception handling for Level 2 functions when the host memory allocation exceeds the available memory</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>install.sh internally runs rmake.py (also used on windows) and rmake.py may be used directly by developers on linux (use --help)</li>
<li>rocblas client executables all now begin with rocblas- prefix</li>
</ul>
<h5>Removed</h5>
<ul>
<li>install.sh removed options -o --cov as now Tensile will use the default COV format, set by cmake define Tensile_CODE_OBJECT_VERSION=default</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocFFT 1.0.22</h4>
<p>rocFFT 1.0.22 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Optimizations</h5>
<ul>
<li>Improved performance of 1D lengths &lt; 2048 that use Bluestein&#39;s algorithm.</li>
<li>Reduced time for generating code during plan creation.</li>
<li>Optimized 3D R2C/C2R lengths 32, 84, 128.</li>
<li>Optimized batched small 1D R2C/C2R cases.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added gfx1101 to default AMDGPU_TARGETS.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Moved client programs to C++17.</li>
<li>Moved planar kernels and infrequently used Stockham kernels to be runtime-compiled.</li>
<li>Moved transpose, real-complex, Bluestein, and Stockham kernels to library kernel cache.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Removed zero-length twiddle table allocations, which fixes errors from hipMallocManaged.</li>
<li>Fixed incorrect freeing of HIP stream handles during twiddle computation when multiple devices are present.</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocPRIM 2.13.0</h4>
<p>rocPRIM 2.13.0 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>New block level <code>radix_rank</code> primitive.</li>
<li>New block level <code>radix_rank_match</code> primitive.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Improved the performance of <code>block_radix_sort</code> and <code>device_radix_sort</code>.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Known Issues</h5>
<ul>
<li>Disabled GPU error messages relating to incorrect warp operation usage with Navi GPUs on Windows, due to GPU printf performance issues on Windows.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Fixed benchmark build on Windows</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocRAND 2.10.17</h4>
<p>rocRAND 2.10.17 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>MT19937 pseudo random number generator based on M. Matsumoto and T. Nishimura, 1998, Mersenne Twister: A 623-dimensionally equidistributed uniform pseudorandom number generator.</li>
<li>New benchmark for the device API using Google Benchmark, <code>benchmark_rocrand_device_api</code>, replacing <code>benchmark_rocrand_kernel</code>. <code>benchmark_rocrand_kernel</code> is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. Likewise, <code>benchmark_curand_host_api</code> is added to replace <code>benchmark_curand_generate</code> and <code>benchmark_curand_device_api</code> is added to replace <code>benchmark_curand_kernel</code>.</li>
<li>experimental HIP-CPU feature</li>
<li>ThreeFry pseudorandom number generator based on Salmon et al., 2011, &#34;Parallel random numbers: as easy as 1, 2, 3&#34;.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Python 2.7 is no longer officially supported.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Windows HIP SDK support</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocSOLVER 3.21.0</h4>
<p>rocSOLVER 3.21.0 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>SVD for general matrices using Jacobi algorithm:<ul>
<li>GESVDJ (with batched and strided_batched versions)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>LU factorization without pivoting for block tridiagonal matrices:<ul>
<li>GEBLTTRF_NPVT (with batched and strided_batched versions)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Linear system solver without pivoting for block tridiagonal matrices:<ul>
<li>GEBLTTRS_NPVT (with batched and strided_batched, versions)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Product of triangular matrices<ul>
<li>LAUUM</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Added experimental hipGraph support for rocSOLVER functions</li>
</ul>
<h5>Optimized</h5>
<ul>
<li>Improved the performance of SYEVJ/HEEVJ.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>STEDC, SYEVD/HEEVD and SYGVD/HEGVD now use fully implemented Divide and Conquer approach.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>SYEVJ/HEEVJ should now be invariant under matrix scaling.</li>
<li>SYEVJ/HEEVJ should now properly output the eigenvalues when no sweeps are executed.</li>
<li>Fixed GETF2_NPVT and GETRF_NPVT input data initialization in tests and benchmarks.</li>
<li>Fixed rocblas missing from the dependency list of the rocsolver deb and rpm packages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocSPARSE 2.5.1</h4>
<p>rocSPARSE 2.5.1 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added bsrgemm and spgemm for BSR format</li>
<li>Added bsrgeam</li>
<li>Added build support for Navi32</li>
<li>Added experimental hipGraph support for some rocSPARSE routines</li>
<li>Added csritsv, spitsv csr iterative triangular solve</li>
<li>Added mixed precisions for SpMV</li>
<li>Added batched SpMM for transpose A in COO format with atomic atomic algorithm</li>
</ul>
<h5>Improved</h5>
<ul>
<li>Optimization to csr2bsr</li>
<li>Optimization to csr2csr_compress</li>
<li>Optimization to csr2coo</li>
<li>Optimization to gebsr2csr</li>
<li>Optimization to csr2gebsr</li>
<li>Fixes to documentation</li>
<li>Fixes a bug in COO SpMV gridsize</li>
<li>Fixes a bug in SpMM gridsize when using very large matrices</li>
</ul>
<h5>Known Issues</h5>
<ul>
<li>In csritlu0, the algorithm rocsparse_itilu0_alg_sync_split_fusion has some accuracy issues to investigate with XNACK enabled. The fallback is rocsparse_itilu0_alg_sync_split.</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocWMMA 1.0</h4>
<p>rocWMMA 1.0 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added support for wave32 on gfx11+</li>
<li>Added infrastructure changes to support hipRTC</li>
<li>Added performance tracking system</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Modified the assignment of hardware information</li>
<li>Modified the data access for unsigned datatypes</li>
<li>Added library config to support multiple architectures</li>
</ul>
<h4>Tensile 4.36.0</h4>
<p>Tensile 4.36.0 for ROCm 5.5.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Add functions for user-driven tuning</li>
<li>Add GFX11 support: HostLibraryTests yamls, rearragne FP32(C)/FP64(C) instruction order, archCaps for instruction renaming condition, adjust vgpr bank for A/B/C for optimize, separate vscnt and vmcnt, dual mac</li>
<li>Add binary search for Grid-Based algorithm</li>
<li>Add reject condition for (StoreCInUnroll + BufferStore=0) and (DirectToVgpr + ScheduleIterAlg&lt;3 + PrefetchGlobalRead==2)</li>
<li>Add support for (DirectToLds + hgemm + NN/NT/TT) and (DirectToLds + hgemm + GlobalLoadVectorWidth &lt; 4)</li>
<li>Add support for (DirectToLds + hgemm(TLU=True only) or sgemm + NumLoadsCoalesced &gt; 1)</li>
<li>Add GSU SingleBuffer algorithm for HSS/BSS</li>
<li>Add gfx900:xnack-, gfx1032, gfx1034, gfx1035</li>
<li>Enable gfx1031 support</li>
</ul>
<h5>Optimizations</h5>
<ul>
<li>Use AssertSizeLessThan for BufferStoreOffsetLimitCheck if it is smaller than MT1</li>
<li>Improve InitAccVgprOpt</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Use global_atomic for GSU instead of flat and global_store for debug code</li>
<li>Replace flat_load/store with global_load/store</li>
<li>Use global_load/store for BufferLoad/Store=0 and enable scheduling</li>
<li>LocalSplitU support for HGEMM+HPA when MFMA disabled</li>
<li>Update Code Object Version</li>
<li>Type cast local memory to COMPUTE_DATA_TYPE in LDS to avoid precision loss</li>
<li>Update asm cap cache arguments</li>
<li>Unify SplitGlobalRead into ThreadSeparateGlobalRead and remove SplitGlobalRead</li>
<li>Change checks, error messages, assembly syntax, and coverage for DirectToLds</li>
<li>Remove unused cmake file</li>
<li>Clean up the LLVM dependency code</li>
<li>Update ThreadSeparateGlobalRead test cases for PrefetchGlobalRead=2</li>
<li>Update sgemm/hgemm test cases for DirectToLds and ThreadSepareteGlobalRead</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Add build-id to header of compiled source kernels</li>
<li>Fix solution index collisions</li>
<li>Fix h beta vectorwidth4 correctness issue for WMMA</li>
<li>Fix an error with BufferStore=0</li>
<li>Fix mismatch issue with (StoreCInUnroll + PrefetchGlobalRead=2)</li>
<li>Fix MoveMIoutToArch bug</li>
<li>Fix flat load correctness issue on I8 and flat store correctness issue</li>
<li>Fix mismatch issue with BufferLoad=0 + TailLoop for large array sizes</li>
<li>Fix code generation error with BufferStore=0 and StoreCInUnrollPostLoop</li>
<li>Fix issues with DirectToVgpr + ScheduleIterAlg&lt;3</li>
<li>Fix mismatch issue with DGEMM TT + LocalReadVectorWidth=2</li>
<li>Fix mismatch issue with PrefetchGlobalRead=2</li>
<li>Fix mismatch issue with DirectToVgpr + PrefetchGlobalRead=2 + small tile size</li>
<li>Fix an error with PersistentKernel=0 + PrefetchAcrossPersistent=1 + PrefetchAcrossPersistentMode=1</li>
<li>Fix mismatch issue with DirectToVgpr + DirectToLds + only 1 iteration in unroll loop case</li>
<li>Remove duplicate GSU kernels: for GSU = 1, GSUAlgorithm SingleBuffer and MultipleBuffer kernels are identical</li>
<li>Fix for failing CI tests due to CpuThreads=0</li>
<li>Fix mismatch issue with DirectToLds + PrefetchGlobalRead=2</li>
<li>Remove the reject condition for ThreadSeparateGlobalRead and DirectToLds (HGEMM, SGEMM only)</li>
<li>Modify reject condition for minimum lanes of ThreadSeparateGlobalRead (SGEMM or larger data type only)</li>
</ul>
<hr />
<h2>ROCm 5.4.3</h2>
<!-- markdownlint-disable first-line-h1 -->
<h3>Deprecations and Warnings</h3>
<h4>HIP Perl Scripts Deprecation</h4>
<p>The <code>hipcc</code> and <code>hipconfig</code> Perl scripts are deprecated. In a future release, compiled binaries will be available as <code>hipcc.bin</code> and <code>hipconfig.bin</code> as replacements for the Perl scripts.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>There will be a transition period where the Perl scripts and compiled binaries are available  before the scripts are removed. There will be no functional difference between the Perl scripts and their compiled binary counterpart. No user action is required. Once these are available, users can optionally switch to <code>hipcc.bin</code> and <code>hipconfig.bin</code>. The <code>hipcc</code>/<code>hipconfig</code> soft link will be assimilated to point from <code>hipcc</code>/<code>hipconfig</code> to the respective compiled binaries as the default option.</p>
</blockquote>
<h5>Linux Filesystem Hierarchy Standard for ROCm</h5>
<p>ROCm packages have adopted the Linux foundation filesystem hierarchy standard in this release to ensure ROCm components follow open source conventions for Linux-based distributions. While moving to a new filesystem hierarchy, ROCm ensures backward compatibility with its 5.1 version or older filesystem hierarchy. See below for a detailed explanation of the new filesystem hierarchy and backward compatibility.</p>
<h5>New Filesystem Hierarchy</h5>
<p>The following is the new filesystem hierarchy:4</p>
<p>```text
/opt/rocm-<ver>
    | --bin
      | --All externally exposed Binaries
    | --libexec
        | --<component>
            | -- Component specific private non-ISA executables (architecture independent)
    | --include
        | -- <component>
            | --<header files>
    | --lib
        | --lib<soname>.so -&gt; lib<soname>.so.major -&gt; lib<soname>.so.major.minor.patch
            (public libraries linked with application)
        | --<component> (component specific private library, executable data)
        | --<cmake>
            | --components
                | --<component>.config.cmake
    | --share
        | --html/<component>/<em>.html
        | --info/<component>/</em>.[pdf, md, txt]
        | --man
        | --doc
            | --<component>
                | --<licenses>
        | --<component>
            | --<misc files> (arch independent non-executable)
            | --samples</p>
<p>```</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>ROCm will not support backward compatibility with the v5.1(old) file system hierarchy in its next major release.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>For more information, refer to <a href="https://refspecs.linuxfoundation.org/fhs.shtml">https://refspecs.linuxfoundation.org/fhs.shtml</a>.</p>
<h5>Backward Compatibility with Older Filesystems</h5>
<p>ROCm has moved header files and libraries to its new location as indicated in the above structure and included symbolic-link and wrapper header files in its old location for backward compatibility.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>ROCm will continue supporting backward compatibility until the next major release.</p>
</blockquote>
<h5>Wrapper header files</h5>
<p>Wrapper header files are placed in the old location (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/&lt;component&gt;/include</code>) with a warning message to include files from the new location (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/include</code>) as shown in the example below:</p>
<p>```h
// Code snippet from hip_runtime.h</p>
<h1>pragma message âThis file is deprecated. Use file from include path /opt/rocm-ver/include/ and prefix with hipâ.</h1>
<h1>include "hip/hip_runtime.h"</h1>
<p>```</p>
<p>The wrapper header filesâ backward compatibility deprecation is as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>#pragma</code> message announcing deprecation -- ROCm v5.2 release</li>
<li><code>#pragma</code> message changed to <code>#warning</code> -- Future release</li>
<li><code>#warning</code> changed to <code>#error</code> -- Future release</li>
<li>Backward compatibility wrappers removed -- Future release</li>
</ul>
<h5>Library files</h5>
<p>Library files are available in the <code>/opt/rocm-xxx/lib</code> folder. For backward compatibility, the old library location (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/&lt;component&gt;/lib</code>) has a soft link to the library at the new location.</p>
<p>Example:</p>
<p><code>log
$ ls -l /opt/rocm/hip/lib/
total 4
drwxr-xr-x 4 root root 4096 May 12 10:45 cmake
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root   24 May 10 23:32 libamdhip64.so -&gt; ../../lib/libamdhip64.so</code></p>
<h5>CMake Config files</h5>
<p>All CMake configuration files are available in the <code>/opt/rocm-xxx/lib/cmake/&lt;component&gt;</code> folder. For backward compatibility, the old CMake locations (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/&lt;component&gt;/lib/cmake</code>) consist of a soft link to the new CMake config.</p>
<p>Example:</p>
<p><code>log
$ ls -l /opt/rocm/hip/lib/cmake/hip/
total 0
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 42 May 10 23:32 hip-config.cmake -&gt; ../../../../lib/cmake/hip/hip-config.cmake</code></p>
<h3>Fixed Defects</h3>
<h4>Compiler Improvements</h4>
<p>In ROCm v5.4.3, improvements to the compiler address errors with the following signatures:</p>
<ul>
<li>"error: unhandled SGPR spill to memory"</li>
<li>"cannot scavenge register without an emergency spill slot!"</li>
<li>"error: ran out of registers during register allocation"</li>
</ul>
<h3>Known Issues</h3>
<h4>Compiler Option Error at Runtime</h4>
<p>Some users may encounter a âCannot find Symbolâ error at runtime when using -save-temps. While most -save-temps use cases work correctly, this error may appear occasionally.</p>
<p>This issue is under investigation, and the known workaround is not to use -save-temps when the error appears.</p>
<h3>Library Changes in ROCM 5.4.3</h3>
<p>| Library | Version |
|---------|---------|
| hipBLAS | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">0.53.0</a> |
| hipCUB | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipCUB/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">2.13.0</a> |
| hipFFT | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipFFT/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">1.0.10</a> |
| hipSOLVER | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipSOLVER/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">1.6.0</a> |
| hipSPARSE | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipSPARSE/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">2.3.3</a> |
| rccl | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rccl/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">2.13.4</a> |
| rocALUTION | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocALUTION/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">2.1.3</a> |
| rocBLAS | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">2.46.0</a> |
| rocFFT | 1.0.20 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocFFT/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">1.0.21</a> |
| rocPRIM | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocPRIM/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">2.12.0</a> |
| rocRAND | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocRAND/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">2.10.16</a> |
| rocSOLVER | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocSOLVER/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">3.20.0</a> |
| rocSPARSE | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocSPARSE/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">2.4.0</a> |
| rocThrust | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocThrust/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">2.17.0</a> |
| rocWMMA | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocWMMA/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">0.9</a> |
| Tensile | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/Tensile/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.3">4.35.0</a> |</p>
<h4>rocFFT 1.0.21</h4>
<p>rocFFT 1.0.21 for ROCm 5.4.3</p>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Removed source directory from rocm_install_targets call to prevent installation of rocfft.h in an unintended location.</li>
</ul>
<hr />
<h2>ROCm 5.4.2</h2>
<!-- markdownlint-disable first-line-h1 -->
<h3>Deprecations and Warnings</h3>
<h4>HIP Perl Scripts Deprecation</h4>
<p>The <code>hipcc</code> and <code>hipconfig</code> Perl scripts are deprecated. In a future release, compiled binaries will be available as <code>hipcc.bin</code> and <code>hipconfig.bin</code> as replacements for the Perl scripts.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>There will be a transition period where the Perl scripts and compiled binaries are available  before the scripts are removed. There will be no functional difference between the Perl scripts and their compiled binary counterpart. No user action is required. Once these are available, users can optionally switch to <code>hipcc.bin</code> and <code>hipconfig.bin</code>. The <code>hipcc</code>/<code>hipconfig</code> soft link will be assimilated to point from <code>hipcc</code>/<code>hipconfig</code> to the respective compiled binaries as the default option.</p>
</blockquote>
<h4><code>hipcc</code> Options Deprecation</h4>
<p>The following hipcc options are being deprecated and will be removed in a future release:</p>
<ul>
<li>The <code>--amdgpu-target</code> option is being deprecated, and user must use the <code>âoffload-arch</code> option to specify the GPU architecture.</li>
<li>The <code>--amdhsa-code-object-version</code> option is being deprecated.  Users can use the Clang/LLVM option <code>-mllvm -mcode-object-version</code> to debug issues related to code object versions.</li>
<li>The <code>--hipcc-func-supp</code>/<code>--hipcc-no-func-supp</code> options are being deprecated, as the function calls are already supported in production on AMD GPUs.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Known Issues</h3>
<p>Under certain circumstances typified by high register pressure, users may encounter a compiler abort with one of the following error messages:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<blockquote>
<p><code>error: unhandled SGPR spill to memory</code></p>
</blockquote>
</li>
<li>
<blockquote>
<p><code>cannot scavenge register without an emergency spill slot!</code></p>
</blockquote>
</li>
<li>
<blockquote>
<p><code>error: ran out of registers during register allocation</code></p>
</blockquote>
</li>
</ul>
<p>This is a known issue and will be fixed in a future release.</p>
<h3>Library Changes in ROCM 5.4.2</h3>
<p>| Library | Version |
|---------|---------|
| hipBLAS | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">0.53.0</a> |
| hipCUB | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipCUB/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">2.13.0</a> |
| hipFFT | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipFFT/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">1.0.10</a> |
| hipSOLVER | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipSOLVER/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">1.6.0</a> |
| hipSPARSE | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipSPARSE/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">2.3.3</a> |
| rccl | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rccl/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">2.13.4</a> |
| rocALUTION | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocALUTION/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">2.1.3</a> |
| rocBLAS | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">2.46.0</a> |
| rocFFT | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocFFT/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">1.0.20</a> |
| rocPRIM | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocPRIM/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">2.12.0</a> |
| rocRAND | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocRAND/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">2.10.16</a> |
| rocSOLVER | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocSOLVER/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">3.20.0</a> |
| rocSPARSE | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocSPARSE/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">2.4.0</a> |
| rocThrust | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocThrust/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">2.17.0</a> |
| rocWMMA | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocWMMA/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">0.9</a> |
| Tensile | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/Tensile/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.2">4.35.0</a> |</p>
<hr />
<h2>ROCm 5.4.1</h2>
<!-- markdownlint-disable first-line-h1 -->
<h3>What's New in This Release</h3>
<h4>HIP Enhancements</h4>
<p>The ROCm v5.4.1 release consists of the following new HIP API:</p>
<h5>New HIP API - hipLaunchHostFunc</h5>
<p>The following new HIP API is introduced in the ROCm v5.4.1 release.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>This is a pre-official version (beta) release of the new APIs.</p>
</blockquote>
<p><code>h
hipError_t hipLaunchHostFunc(hipStream_t stream, hipHostFn_t fn, void* userData);</code></p>
<p>This swaps the stream capture mode of a thread.</p>
<p><code>text
@param [in] mode - Pointer to mode value to swap with the current mode</code></p>
<p>This parameter returns <code>#hipSuccess</code>, <code>#hipErrorInvalidValue</code>.</p>
<p>For more information, refer to the HIP API documentation at /bundle/HIP_API_Guide/page/modules.html.</p>
<h3>Deprecations and Warnings</h3>
<h4>HIP Perl Scripts Deprecation</h4>
<p>The <code>hipcc</code> and <code>hipconfig</code> Perl scripts are deprecated. In a future release, compiled binaries will be available as <code>hipcc.bin</code> and <code>hipconfig.bin</code> as replacements for the Perl scripts.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>There will be a transition period where the Perl scripts and compiled binaries are available  before the scripts are removed. There will be no functional difference between the Perl scripts and their compiled binary counterpart. No user action is required. Once these are available, users can optionally switch to <code>hipcc.bin</code> and <code>hipconfig.bin</code>. The <code>hipcc</code>/<code>hipconfig</code> soft link will be assimilated to point from <code>hipcc</code>/<code>hipconfig</code> to the respective compiled binaries as the default option.</p>
</blockquote>
<h3>IFWI Fixes</h3>
<p>These defects were identified and documented as known issues in previous ROCm releases and are fixed in this release.
AMD Instinctâ¢ MI200 Firmware IFWI Maintenance Update #3</p>
<p>This IFWI release fixes the following issue in AMD Instinctâ¢ MI210/MI250 Accelerators.</p>
<p>After prolonged periods of operation, certain MI200 Instinctâ¢ Accelerators may perform in a degraded way resulting in application failures.</p>
<p>In this package, AMD delivers a new firmware version for MI200 GPU accelerators and a firmware installation tool â AMD FW FLASH 1.2.</p>
<p>| GPU   | Production Part Number | SKU | IFWI Name |
|-------|------------|--------|---------------|
| MI210 | 113-D673XX | D67302 | D6730200V.110 |
| MI210 | 113-D673XX | D67301 | D6730100V.073 |
| MI250 | 113-D652XX | D65209 | D6520900.073  |
| MI250 | 113-D652XX | D65210 | D6521000.073  |</p>
<p>Instructions on how to download and apply MI200 maintenance updates are available at:</p>
<p><a href="https://www.amd.com/en/support/server-accelerators/amd-instinct/amd-instinct-mi-series/amd-instinct-mi210">https://www.amd.com/en/support/server-accelerators/amd-instinct/amd-instinct-mi-series/amd-instinct-mi210</a></p>
<h4>AMD Instinctâ¢ MI200 SRIOV Virtualization Support</h4>
<p>Maintenance update #3, combined with ROCm 5.4.1, now provides SRIOV virtualization support for all AMD Instinctâ¢ MI200 devices.</p>
<h3>Library Changes in ROCM 5.4.1</h3>
<p>| Library | Version |
|---------|---------|
| hipBLAS | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">0.53.0</a> |
| hipCUB | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipCUB/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">2.13.0</a> |
| hipFFT | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipFFT/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">1.0.10</a> |
| hipSOLVER | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipSOLVER/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">1.6.0</a> |
| hipSPARSE | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipSPARSE/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">2.3.3</a> |
| rccl | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rccl/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">2.13.4</a> |
| rocALUTION | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocALUTION/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">2.1.3</a> |
| rocBLAS | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">2.46.0</a> |
| rocFFT | 1.0.19 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocFFT/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">1.0.20</a> |
| rocPRIM | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocPRIM/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">2.12.0</a> |
| rocRAND | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocRAND/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">2.10.16</a> |
| rocSOLVER | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocSOLVER/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">3.20.0</a> |
| rocSPARSE | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocSPARSE/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">2.4.0</a> |
| rocThrust | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocThrust/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">2.17.0</a> |
| rocWMMA | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocWMMA/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">0.9</a> |
| Tensile | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/Tensile/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.1">4.35.0</a> |</p>
<h4>rocFFT 1.0.20</h4>
<p>rocFFT 1.0.20 for ROCm 5.4.1</p>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Fixed incorrect results on strided large 1D FFTs where batch size does not equal the stride.</li>
</ul>
<hr />
<h2>ROCm 5.4.0</h2>
<!-- markdownlint-disable first-line-h1 -->
<!-- markdownlint-disable no-duplicate-header -->
<h3>What's New in This Release</h3>
<h4>HIP Enhancements</h4>
<p>The ROCm v5.4 release consists of the following HIP enhancements:</p>
<h5>Support for Wall Clock64</h5>
<p>A new timer function wall_clock64() is supported, which returns wall clock count at a constant frequency on the device.</p>
<p><code>h
long long int wall_clock64();</code></p>
<p>It returns wall clock count at a constant frequency on the device, which can be queried via HIP API with the hipDeviceAttributeWallClockRate attribute of the device in the HIP application code.</p>
<p>Example:</p>
<p><code>h
int wallClkRate = 0; //in kilohertz
+HIPCHECK(hipDeviceGetAttribute(&amp;wallClkRate, hipDeviceAttributeWallClockRate, deviceId));</code></p>
<p>Where hipDeviceAttributeWallClockRate is a device attribute.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>The wall clock frequency is a per-device attribute.</p>
</blockquote>
<h5>New Registry Added for GPU_MAX_HW_QUEUES</h5>
<p>The GPU_MAX_HW_QUEUES registry defines the maximum number of independent hardware queues allocated per process per device.</p>
<p>The environment variable controls how many independent hardware queues HIP runtime can create per process, per device. If the application allocates more HIP streams than this number, then the HIP runtime reuses the same hardware queues for the new streams in a round-robin manner.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>This maximum number does not apply to hardware queues created for CU-masked HIP streams or cooperative queues for HIP Cooperative Groups (there is only one queue per device).</p>
</blockquote>
<p>For more details, refer to the HIP Programming Guide.</p>
<h4>New HIP APIs in This Release</h4>
<p>The following new HIP APIs are available in the ROCm v5.4 release.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>This is a pre-official version (beta) release of the new APIs.</p>
</blockquote>
<h5>Error Handling</h5>
<p><code>h
hipError_t hipDrvGetErrorName(hipError_t hipError, const char** errorString);</code></p>
<p>This returns HIP errors in the text string format.</p>
<p><code>h
hipError_t hipDrvGetErrorString(hipError_t hipError, const char** errorString);</code></p>
<p>This returns text string messages with more details about the error.</p>
<p>For more information, refer to the HIP API Guide.</p>
<h5>HIP Tests Source Separation</h5>
<p>With ROCm v5.4, a separate GitHub project is created at</p>
<p><a href="https://github.com/ROCm-Developer-Tools/hip-tests">https://github.com/ROCm-Developer-Tools/hip-tests</a></p>
<p>This contains HIP catch2 tests and samples, and new tests will continue to develop.</p>
<p>In future ROCm releases, catch2 tests and samples will be removed from the HIP project.</p>
<h3>OpenMP Enhancements</h3>
<p>This release consists of the following OpenMP enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Enable new device RTL in libomptarget as default.</li>
<li>New flag <code>-fopenmp-target-fast</code> to imply <code>-fopenmp-target-ignore-env-vars -fopenmp-assume-no-thread-state -fopenmp-assume-no-nested-parallelism</code>.</li>
<li>Support for the collapse clause and non-unit stride in cases where the No-Loop specialized kernel is generated.</li>
<li>Initial implementation of optimized cross-team sum reduction for float and double type scalars.</li>
<li>Pool-based optimization in the OpenMP runtime to reduce locking during data transfer.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Deprecations and Warnings</h3>
<h4>HIP Perl Scripts Deprecation</h4>
<p>The <code>hipcc</code> and <code>hipconfig</code> Perl scripts are deprecated. In a future release, compiled binaries will be available as <code>hipcc.bin</code> and <code>hipconfig.bin</code> as replacements for the Perl scripts.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>There will be a transition period where the Perl scripts and compiled binaries are available  before the scripts are removed. There will be no functional difference between the Perl scripts and their compiled binary counterpart. No user action is required. Once these are available, users can optionally switch to <code>hipcc.bin</code> and <code>hipconfig.bin</code>. The <code>hipcc</code>/<code>hipconfig</code> soft link will be assimilated to point from <code>hipcc</code>/<code>hipconfig</code> to the respective compiled binaries as the default option.</p>
</blockquote>
<h5>Linux Filesystem Hierarchy Standard for ROCm</h5>
<p>ROCm packages have adopted the Linux foundation filesystem hierarchy standard in this release to ensure ROCm components follow open source conventions for Linux-based distributions. While moving to a new filesystem hierarchy, ROCm ensures backward compatibility with its 5.1 version or older filesystem hierarchy. See below for a detailed explanation of the new filesystem hierarchy and backward compatibility.</p>
<h5>New Filesystem Hierarchy</h5>
<p>The following is the new filesystem hierarchy:</p>
<p>```text
/opt/rocm-<ver>
    | --bin
      | --All externally exposed Binaries
    | --libexec
        | --<component>
            | -- Component specific private non-ISA executables (architecture independent)
    | --include
        | -- <component>
            | --<header files>
    | --lib
        | --lib<soname>.so -&gt; lib<soname>.so.major -&gt; lib<soname>.so.major.minor.patch
            (public libraries linked with application)
        | --<component> (component specific private library, executable data)
        | --<cmake>
            | --components
                | --<component>.config.cmake
    | --share
        | --html/<component>/<em>.html
        | --info/<component>/</em>.[pdf, md, txt]
        | --man
        | --doc
            | --<component>
                | --<licenses>
        | --<component>
            | --<misc files> (arch independent non-executable)
            | --samples</p>
<p>```</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>ROCm will not support backward compatibility with the v5.1(old) file system hierarchy in its next major release.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>For more information, refer to <a href="https://refspecs.linuxfoundation.org/fhs.shtml">https://refspecs.linuxfoundation.org/fhs.shtml</a>.</p>
<h5>Backward Compatibility with Older Filesystems</h5>
<p>ROCm has moved header files and libraries to its new location as indicated in the above structure and included symbolic-link and wrapper header files in its old location for backward compatibility.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<p>ROCm will continue supporting backward compatibility until the next major release.</p>
</blockquote>
<h5>Wrapper header files</h5>
<p>Wrapper header files are placed in the old location (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/&lt;component&gt;/include</code>) with a warning message to include files from the new location (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/include</code>) as shown in the example below:</p>
<p>```h
// Code snippet from hip_runtime.h</p>
<h1>pragma message âThis file is deprecated. Use file from include path /opt/rocm-ver/include/ and prefix with hipâ.</h1>
<h1>include "hip/hip_runtime.h"</h1>
<p>```</p>
<p>The wrapper header filesâ backward compatibility deprecation is as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>#pragma</code> message announcing deprecation -- ROCm v5.2 release</li>
<li><code>#pragma</code> message changed to <code>#warning</code> -- Future release</li>
<li><code>#warning</code> changed to <code>#error</code> -- Future release</li>
<li>Backward compatibility wrappers removed -- Future release</li>
</ul>
<h5>Library files</h5>
<p>Library files are available in the <code>/opt/rocm-xxx/lib</code> folder. For backward compatibility, the old library location (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/&lt;component&gt;/lib</code>) has a soft link to the library at the new location.</p>
<p>Example:</p>
<p><code>log
$ ls -l /opt/rocm/hip/lib/
total 4
drwxr-xr-x 4 root root 4096 May 12 10:45 cmake
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root   24 May 10 23:32 libamdhip64.so -&gt; ../../lib/libamdhip64.so</code></p>
<h5>CMake Config files</h5>
<p>All CMake configuration files are available in the <code>/opt/rocm-xxx/lib/cmake/&lt;component&gt;</code> folder. For backward compatibility, the old CMake locations (<code>/opt/rocm-xxx/&lt;component&gt;/lib/cmake</code>) consist of a soft link to the new CMake config.</p>
<p>Example:</p>
<p><code>log
$ ls -l /opt/rocm/hip/lib/cmake/hip/
total 0
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 42 May 10 23:32 hip-config.cmake -&gt; ../../../../lib/cmake/hip/hip-config.cmake</code></p>
<h3>Fixed Defects</h3>
<p>The following defects are fixed in this release.</p>
<p>These defects were identified and documented as known issues in previous ROCm releases and are fixed in this release.</p>
<h4>Memory Allocated Using hipHostMalloc() with Flags Did Not Exhibit Fine-Grain Behavior</h4>
<h5>Issue</h5>
<p>The test was incorrectly using the <code>hipDeviceAttributePageableMemoryAccess</code> device attribute to determine coherent support.</p>
<h5>Fix</h5>
<p><code>hipHostMalloc()</code> allocates memory with fine-grained access by default when the environment variable <code>HIP_HOST_COHERENT=1</code> is used.</p>
<p>For more information, refer to the HIP Programming Guide at</p>
<p><a href="https://docs.amd.com/bundle/HIP-Programming-Guide-v5.4/page/Introduction_to_HIP_Programming_Guide.html">https://docs.amd.com/bundle/HIP-Programming-Guide-v5.4/page/Introduction_to_HIP_Programming_Guide.html</a></p>
<h4>SoftHang with <code>hipStreamWithCUMask</code> test on AMD Instinctâ¢</h4>
<h5>Issue</h5>
<p>On GFX10 GPUs, kernel execution hangs when it is launched on streams created using <code>hipStreamWithCUMask</code>.</p>
<h5>Fix</h5>
<p>On GFX10 GPUs, each workgroup processor encompasses two compute units, and the compute units must be enabled as a pair. The <code>hipStreamWithCUMask</code> API unit test cases are updated to set compute unit mask (cuMask) in pairs for GFX10 GPUs.</p>
<h4>ROCm Tools GPU IDs</h4>
<p>The HIP language device IDs are not the same as the GPU IDs reported by the tools. GPU IDs are globally unique and guaranteed to be consistent across APIs and processes.</p>
<p>GPU IDs reported by ROCTracer and ROCProfiler or ROCm Tools are HSA Driver Node ID of that GPU, as it is a unique ID for that device in that particular node.</p>
<h3>Library Changes in ROCM 5.4.0</h3>
<p>| Library | Version |
|---------|---------|
| hipBLAS | 0.52.0 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">0.53.0</a> |
| hipCUB | 2.12.0 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipCUB/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">2.13.0</a> |
| hipFFT | 1.0.9 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipFFT/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">1.0.10</a> |
| hipSOLVER | 1.5.0 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipSOLVER/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">1.6.0</a> |
| hipSPARSE | 2.3.1 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipSPARSE/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">2.3.3</a> |
| rccl | 2.12.10 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rccl/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">2.13.4</a> |
| rocALUTION | 2.1.0 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocALUTION/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">2.1.3</a> |
| rocBLAS | 2.45.0 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">2.46.0</a> |
| rocFFT | 1.0.18 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocFFT/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">1.0.19</a> |
| rocPRIM | 2.11.0 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocPRIM/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">2.12.0</a> |
| rocRAND | 2.10.15 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocRAND/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">2.10.16</a> |
| rocSOLVER | 3.19.0 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocSOLVER/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">3.20.0</a> |
| rocSPARSE | 2.2.0 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocSPARSE/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">2.4.0</a> |
| rocThrust | 2.16.0 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocThrust/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">2.17.0</a> |
| rocWMMA | 0.8 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocWMMA/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">0.9</a> |
| Tensile | 4.34.0 â <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/Tensile/releases/tag/rocm-5.4.0">4.35.0</a> |</p>
<h4>hipBLAS 0.53.0</h4>
<p>hipBLAS 0.53.0 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Allow for selection of int8 datatype</li>
<li>Added support for hipblasXgels and hipblasXgelsStridedBatched operations (with s,d,c,z precisions),
  only supported with rocBLAS backend</li>
<li>Added support for hipblasXgelsBatched operations (with s,d,c,z precisions)</li>
</ul>
<h4>hipCUB 2.13.0</h4>
<p>hipCUB 2.13.0 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>CMake functionality to improve build parallelism of the test suite that splits compilation units by
function or by parameters.</li>
<li>New overload for <code>BlockAdjacentDifference::SubtractLeftPartialTile</code> that takes a predecessor item.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Improved build parallelism of the test suite by splitting up large compilation units for <code>DeviceRadixSort</code>, 
<code>DeviceSegmentedRadixSort</code> and <code>DeviceSegmentedSort</code>.</li>
<li>CUB backend references CUB and thrust version 1.17.1.</li>
</ul>
<h4>hipFFT 1.0.10</h4>
<p>hipFFT 1.0.10 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added hipfftExtPlanScaleFactor API to efficiently multiply each output element of a FFT by a given scaling factor.  Result scaling must be supported in the backend FFT library.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>When hipFFT is built against the rocFFT backend, rocFFT 1.0.19 or higher is now required.</li>
</ul>
<h4>hipSOLVER 1.6.0</h4>
<p>hipSOLVER 1.6.0 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added compatibility-only functions</li>
<li>gesvdaStridedBatched<ul>
<li>hipsolverDnSgesvdaStridedBatched_bufferSize, hipsolverDnDgesvdaStridedBatched_bufferSize, hipsolverDnCgesvdaStridedBatched_bufferSize, hipsolverDnZgesvdaStridedBatched_bufferSize</li>
<li>hipsolverDnSgesvdaStridedBatched, hipsolverDnDgesvdaStridedBatched, hipsolverDnCgesvdaStridedBatched, hipsolverDnZgesvdaStridedBatched</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>hipSPARSE 2.3.3</h4>
<p>hipSPARSE 2.3.3 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added hipsparseCsr2cscEx2_bufferSize and hipsparseCsr2cscEx2 routines</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>HIPSPARSE_ORDER_COLUMN has been renamed to HIPSPARSE_ORDER_COL to match cusparse</li>
</ul>
<h4>rccl 2.13.4</h4>
<p>RCCL 2.13.4 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Compatibility with NCCL 2.13.4</li>
<li>Improvements to RCCL when running with hipGraphs</li>
<li>RCCL_ENABLE_HIPGRAPH environment variable is no longer necessary to enable hipGraph support</li>
<li>Minor latency improvements</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Resolved potential memory access error due to asynchronous memset</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocALUTION 2.1.3</h4>
<p>rocALUTION 2.1.3 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added build support for Navi31 and Navi33</li>
<li>Added support for non-squared global matrices</li>
</ul>
<h5>Improved</h5>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a memory leak in MatrixMult on HIP backend</li>
<li>Global structures can now be used with a single process</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Switched GTest death test style to &#39;threadsafe&#39;</li>
<li>GlobalVector::GetGhostSize() is deprecated and will be removed</li>
<li>ParallelManager::GetGlobalSize(), ParallelManager::GetLocalSize(), ParallelManager::SetGlobalSize() and ParallelManager::SetLocalSize() are deprecated and will be removed</li>
<li>Vector::GetGhostSize() is deprecated and will be removed</li>
<li>Multigrid::SetOperatorFormat(unsigned int) is deprecated and will be removed, use Multigrid::SetOperatorFormat(unsigned int, int) instead</li>
<li>RugeStuebenAMG::SetCouplingStrength(ValueType) is deprecated and will be removed, use SetStrengthThreshold(float) instead</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocBLAS 2.46.0</h4>
<p>rocBLAS 2.46.0 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>client smoke test dataset added for quick validation using command rocblas-test --yaml rocblas_smoke.yaml</li>
<li>Added stream order device memory allocation as a non-default beta option.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Optimized</h5>
<ul>
<li>Improved trsm performance for small sizes by using a substitution method technique</li>
<li>Improved syr2k and her2k performance significantly by using a block-recursive algorithm</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Level 2, Level 1, and Extension functions: argument checking when the handle is set to rocblas_pointer_mode_host now returns the status of rocblas_status_invalid_pointer only for pointers that must be dereferenced based on the alpha and beta argument values.  With handle mode rocblas_pointer_mode_device only pointers that are always dereferenced regardless of alpha and beta values are checked and so may lead to a return status of rocblas_status_invalid_pointer.   This improves consistency with legacy BLAS behaviour.</li>
<li>Add variable to turn on/off ieee16/ieee32 tests for mixed precision gemm</li>
<li>Allow hipBLAS to select int8 datatype</li>
<li>Disallow B == C &amp;&amp; ldb != ldc in rocblas_xtrmm_outofplace</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>FORTRAN interfaces generalized for FORTRAN compilers other than gfortran</li>
<li>fix for trsm_strided_batched rocblas-bench performance gathering</li>
<li>Fix for rocm-smi path in commandrunner.py script to match ROCm 5.2 and above</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocFFT 1.0.19</h4>
<p>rocFFT 1.0.19 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Optimizations</h5>
<ul>
<li>Optimized some strided large 1D plans.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added rocfft_plan_description_set_scale_factor API to efficiently multiply each output element of a FFT by a given scaling factor.</li>
<li>Created a rocfft_kernel_cache.db file next to the installed library. SBCC kernels are moved to this file when built with the library, and are runtime-compiled for new GPU architectures.</li>
<li>Added gfx1100 and gfx1102 to default AMDGPU_TARGETS.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Moved runtime compilation cache to in-memory by default.  A default on-disk cache can encounter contention problems 
on multi-node clusters with a shared filesystem.  rocFFT can still be told to use an on-disk cache by setting the 
ROCFFT_RTC_CACHE_PATH environment variable.</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocPRIM 2.12.0</h4>
<p>rocPRIM 2.12.0 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li><code>device_partition</code>, <code>device_unique</code>, and <code>device_reduce_by_key</code> now support problem 
  sizes larger than 2^32 items.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Removed</h5>
<ul>
<li><code>block_sort::sort()</code> overload for keys and values with a dynamic size. This overload was documented but the
  implementation is missing. To avoid further confusion the documentation is removed until a decision is made on
  implementing the function.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Fixed the compilation failure in <code>device_merge</code> if the two key iterators don&#39;t match.</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocRAND 2.10.16</h4>
<p>rocRAND 2.10.16 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>MRG31K3P pseudorandom number generator based on L&#39;Ecuyer and Touzin, 2000, &#34;Fast combined multiple recursive generators with multipliers of the form a = Â±2q Â±2r&#34;.</li>
<li>LFSR113 pseudorandom number generator based on L&#39;Ecuyer, 1999, &#34;Tables of maximally equidistributed combined LFSR generators&#34;.</li>
<li>SCRAMBLED_SOBOL32 and SCRAMBLED_SOBOL64 quasirandom number generators. The Scrambled Sobol sequences are generated by scrambling the output of a Sobol sequence.</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>The <code>mrg_&amp;lt;distribution&amp;gt;_distribution</code> structures, which provided numbers based on MRG32K3A, are now replaced by <code>mrg_engine_&amp;lt;distribution&amp;gt;_distribution</code>, where <code>&amp;lt;distribution&amp;gt;</code> is <code>log_normal</code>, <code>normal</code>, <code>poisson</code>, or <code>uniform</code>. These structures provide numbers for MRG31K3P (with template type <code>rocrand_state_mrg31k3p</code>) and MRG32K3A (with template type <code>rocrand_state_mrg32k3a</code>).</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Sobol64 now returns 64 bits random numbers, instead of 32 bits random numbers. As a result, the performance of this generator has regressed.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that prevented compiling code in C++ mode (with a host compiler) when it included the rocRAND headers on Windows.</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocSOLVER 3.20.0</h4>
<p>rocSOLVER 3.20.0 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Partial SVD for bidiagonal matrices:<ul>
<li>BDSVDX</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Partial SVD for general matrices:<ul>
<li>GESVDX (with batched and strided_batched versions)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Changed <code>ROCSOLVER_EMBED_FMT</code> default to <code>ON</code> for users building directly with CMake.
  This matches the existing default when building with install.sh or rmake.py.</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocSPARSE 2.4.0</h4>
<p>rocSPARSE 2.4.0 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added rocsparse_spmv_ex routine</li>
<li>Added rocsparse_bsrmv_ex_analysis and rocsparse_bsrmv_ex routines</li>
<li>Added csritilu0 routine</li>
<li>Added build support for Navi31 and Navi 33</li>
</ul>
<h5>Improved</h5>
<ul>
<li>Optimization to segmented algorithm for COO SpMV by performing analysis</li>
<li>Improve performance when generating random matrices.</li>
<li>Fixed bug in ellmv</li>
<li>Optimized bsr2csr routine</li>
<li>Fixed integer overflow bugs</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocThrust 2.17.0</h4>
<p>rocThrust 2.17.0 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Updated to match upstream Thrust 1.17.0</li>
</ul>
<h4>rocWMMA 0.9</h4>
<p>rocWMMA 0.9 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Added gemm driver APIs for flow control builtins</li>
<li>Added benchmark logging systems</li>
<li>Restructured tests to follow naming convention. Added macros for test generation</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Changed CMake to accomodate the modified test infrastructure</li>
<li>Fine tuned the multi-block kernels with and without lds</li>
<li>Adjusted Maximum Vector Width to dWordx4 Width</li>
<li>Updated Efficiencies to display as whole number percentages</li>
<li>Updated throughput from GFlops/s to TFlops/s</li>
<li>Reset the ad-hoc tests to use smaller sizes</li>
<li>Modified the output validation to use CPU-based implementation against rocWMMA</li>
<li>Modified the extended vector test to return error codes for memory allocation failures</li>
</ul>
<h4>Tensile 4.35.0</h4>
<p>Tensile 4.35.0 for ROCm 5.4.0</p>
<h5>Added</h5>
<ul>
<li>Async DMA support for Transpose Data Layout (ThreadSeparateGlobalReadA/B)</li>
<li>Option to output library logic in dictionary format</li>
<li>No solution found error message for benchmarking client</li>
<li>Exact K check for StoreCInUnrollExact</li>
<li>Support for CGEMM + MIArchVgpr</li>
<li>client-path parameter for using prebuilt client</li>
<li>CleanUpBuildFiles global parameter</li>
<li>Debug flag for printing library logic index of winning solution</li>
<li>NumWarmups global parameter for benchmarking</li>
<li>Windows support for benchmarking client</li>
<li>DirectToVgpr support for CGEMM</li>
<li>TensileLibLogicToYaml for creating tuning configs from library logic solutions</li>
</ul>
<h5>Optimizations</h5>
<ul>
<li>Put beta code and store separately if StoreCInUnroll = x4 store</li>
<li>Improved performance for StoreCInUnroll + b128 store</li>
</ul>
<h5>Changed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Re-enable HardwareMonitor for gfx90a</li>
<li>Decision trees use MLFeatures instead of Properties</li>
</ul>
<h5>Fixed</h5>
<ul>
<li>Reject DirectToVgpr + MatrixInstBM/BN &gt; 1</li>
<li>Fix benchmark timings when using warmups and/or validation</li>
<li>Fix mismatch issue with DirectToVgprB + VectorWidth &gt; 1</li>
<li>Fix mismatch issue with DirectToLds + NumLoadsCoalesced &gt; 1 + TailLoop</li>
<li>Fix incorrect reject condition for DirectToVgpr</li>
<li>Fix reject condition for DirectToVgpr + MIWaveTile &lt; VectorWidth</li>
<li>Fix incorrect instruction generation with StoreCInUnroll</li>
</ul>
<hr />
<h2>ROCm 5.3.3</h2>
<!-- markdownlint-disable first-line-h1 -->
<h3>Fixed Defects</h3>
<h4>Issue with rocTHRUST and rocPRIM Libraries</h4>
<p>There was a known issue with rocTHRUST and rocPRIM libraries supporting iterator and types in ROCm v5.3.x releases.</p>
<ul>
<li><code>thrust::merge</code> no longer correctly supports different iterator types for <code>keys_input1</code> and <code>keys_input2</code>.</li>
<li><code>rocprim::device_merge</code> no longer correctly supports using different types for <code>keys_input1</code> and <code>keys_input2</code>.</li>
</ul>
<p>This issue is resolved with the following fixes to compilation failures:</p>
<ul>
<li>rocPRIM: in device_merge if the two key iterators do not match.</li>
<li>rocTHRUST: in thrust::merge if the two key iterators do not match.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Library Changes in ROCM 5.3.3</h3>
<p>| Library | Version |
|---------|---------|
| hipBLAS | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.3.3">0.52.0</a> |
| hipCUB | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipCUB/releases/tag/rocm-5.3.3">2.12.0</a> |
| hipFFT | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipFFT/releases/tag/rocm-5.3.3">1.0.9</a> |
| hipSOLVER | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipSOLVER/releases/tag/rocm-5.3.3">1.5.0</a> |
| hipSPARSE | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/hipSPARSE/releases/tag/rocm-5.3.3">2.3.1</a> |
| rccl | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rccl/releases/tag/rocm-5.3.3">2.12.10</a> |
| rocALUTION | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocALUTION/releases/tag/rocm-5.3.3">2.1.0</a> |
| rocBLAS | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocBLAS/releases/tag/rocm-5.3.3">2.45.0</a> |
| rocFFT | <a href="https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/rocFFT/releases/tag/rocm-5.3.3">1.0.18</a> |
